text.0: his bright rays bear him up aloft the god who knoweth all that lives.
text.1: sūrya that all may look on him.
text.2: the constellations pass away like thieves together with their beams.
text.4: his herald rays are seen afar refulgent oer the world of men.
text.5: like flames of fire that burn and blaze.
text.6: swift and all beautiful art thou o sūrya maker of the light.
text.8: thou goest to the hosts of gods thou comest hither to mankind.
text.9: hither all light to be beheld.
text.10: with that same eye of thine wherewith thou lookest brilliant varuṇa.
text.11: upon the busy race of men.
text.12: traversing sky and wide midair thou metest with thy beams our days.
text.13: sun seeing all things that have birth.
text.14: seven bay steeds harnessed to thy car bear thee o thou farseeing one.
text.15: god sūrya with the radiant hair.
text.16: sūrya hath yoked the pure bright seven the daughters of the car with these.
text.17: his own dear team he goeth forth.
text.18: looking upon the loftier light above the darkness we have come.
text.19: to sūrya god among the gods the light that is most excellent.
text.20: rising this day o rich in friends ascending to the loftier heaven.
text.21: sūrya remove my hearts disease take from me this my yellow hue.
text.22: to parrots and to starlings let us give away my yellowness.
text.23: or this my yellowness let us transfer to haritāla trees.
text.24: with all his conquering vigour this Āditya hath gone up on high.
text.25: giving my foe into mine hand let me not be my foemans prey.
